metadata.title: CVE-2018-5163 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
If a malicious attacker has used another vulnerability to gain full controlover a content process, they may be able to replace the alternate dataresources stored in the JavaScript Start-up Bytecode Cache (JSBC) for otherJavaScript code. If the parent process then runs this replaced code, theexecuted script would be run with the parent process' privileges, escapingthe sandbox on content processes. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 60.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5163` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
